p: Inorganic nanoparticles (INPs) are utilized for a wide variety of purposes such as targeted imaging for diagnostics, photothermal therapy, medication and many promising applications in the biomedical field [ 74]. Metallic NP (MNP) and nanocarriers (NC) can be categorized under inorganic NP. Smaller particle size, controlled tunability, improved stability, enhanced permeability, large surface-to volume ratio are the characteristic features of inorganic NP [ 75]. Metallic NP such as silver, gold, iron oxide and nanocarriers of silica, titanium, carbon are the most common inorganic -NP. Silver nanoparticles (AgNP) are widely researched nanotechnology approach to treat viral infections. Many assumptions of NP have already been made to develop a novel strategy to eliminate or improve the severity of the infection.
